AI_QUALITY_FAILURES.reasoning: There are no customer-facing AI (ATLAS/Hermes) replies in the thread, and the public responses are coherent and relevant status updates with escalation and resolution. No customer complaint indicates AI was wrong or unhelpful.
evidence: Priyanka Bhotika commented publicly: "We have received your escalation, and our team is currently reviewing the issue."
Pavly Nashed commented publicly: "We have done a preliminary investigation to determine the root cause, and have escalated this to our infrastructure team with the highest priority."

AI_WALL_LOOPING.reasoning: The customer is not shown being stuck in an AI loop; public replies come from named agents and progress toward escalation and fix. The customer does not request a human agent or express frustration with AI interactions in this ticket.
evidence: Priyanka Bhotika commented publicly: "We have received your escalation, and our team is currently reviewing the issue."
Chintan Parekh commented publicly: "We have identified the cause of the chat widget outage and implemented a fix."

IGNORING_CONTEXT.reasoning: Support does not ask the customer to re-provide already-shared recordings/logs, and there is no customer complaint that provided information was ignored. The support responses acknowledge the issue and communicate investigation and resolution.
evidence: Customer (Jayashree Shetty) commented publicly: "Please find the recording attached for your reference."
Pavly Nashed commented publicly: "Thank you for your patience. We have done a preliminary investigation to determine the root cause..."

RESPONSE_DELAYS.reasoning: The ticket shows same-day public acknowledgements and a same-day public resolution update, and there is no customer-facing follow-up indicating they were waiting days without updates. Although the CSV resolutionTime is large, there is no accompanying customer-facing sign of delay as required by the rubric.
evidence: Chintan Parekh commented publicly (same day): "We have identified the cause of the chat widget outage and implemented a fix."

PREMATURE_CLOSURE.reasoning: While the ticket is closed in the CSV, there is no customer-facing evidence that the customer was still waiting on an unresolved request at the time of closure, and no closure warning/notice appears in the public thread.
evidence: Chintan Parekh commented publicly: "We have identified the cause of the chat widget outage and implemented a fix."

P1_SEV1_MISHANDLING.reasoning: The customer reported a SEV1/outage scenario, and support handled it as an incident by escalating with highest priority and delivering a fix update the same day, rather than prolonged generic troubleshooting. The only generic browser note is private and is not the main customer-facing handling.
